lexUnit.name: learn.v

corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

lexUnit.definition: COD: become aware of by information or from observation.

sentence.text: Smacking does n't work , either , because she just learns that you 'll hurt her if you catch her doing it again .
In striving for more respectable customers the exhibitors learnt that it was not just the most affluent who liked to be treated with dignity and style .
The perfectionist has to learn that Jesus was ` poor in spirit " .
As time proceeds they will learn from their mistakes .
We 've just got to learn from the experience and I said to my players afterwards ` welcome to European football " . "
In addition , they promised , we 'd at last learn the real reason why Bobby Orton walked off the field against Burnhope .
Dawn 's parents learned of the accident some three hours later , went immediately to the hospital , and spent much of the rest of the night waiting for information .
We learned that they were on their summer holidays , taking their kayak round the outer reaches of the Arctic .
For example , when Marx learnt about India , China , and Peru , he introduced his oriental or Asiatic stage .
I have developed a theory to explain recent incidents in the light of what I have learned about you .
I was staggered to learn that the Labour party and the Liberal Democrats gave categorical assurances to the House that rate capping or capping of any sort would not be part of their programmes .
He was shocked to learn about the loan .
For example , a chimp may learn an association between poking a stick into termite mounds and extracting a stick covered with edible termites .
The inspection team learned that Iran has the capability to build more centrifuges .
Islamist terrorists launch a `` dirty bomb '' attack against London or another western capital , The Sunday Telegraph has learnt .
One morning he spent in town , and I learned from a casual reference that he had visited the British Museum .
" Great excitement was caused in Esher and the neighbouring district when it was learned late last night that an arrest had been effected in connection with the Oxshott murder .
